EnterBurunCatacombs

Toberik, you crazy hoktor! Well Isparian, it appears as though you brought this report to me in good time. Toberik means to detain Morgluuk's brother, Torgluuk, so that we can face just the one brother. The plan is not without trouble though. We have managed to learn much from the blueprints that we obtained from the Burun fortress in the Blackmire Swamp.

Currently, we believe that the best course of action is to approach the fortress from their north. The walls are weaker there, it appears as though the Renegade builders have been spending more time trying to discern the goals of the Burun and not enough on shoring up their work.

This will not be a simple fight. We will need you to be quick and efficient in your assault. We Lugians will assist the Tumeroks of Marae Lassel in laying an assault against one of the Renegade fortresses to provide you a small amount of assistance.

Once you break the walls down, you will need to enter the catacombs that the Burun have built beneath the fortress. Find your way through and defeat Morgluuk. He is very strong, there may be ways to weaken him without facing him... I would advise trying to find a way to weaken him before assaulting him directly.
Captain K'rank says "Good luck to you, %tn!"
MorgluukKiller
EventHeadMorgluukLinvak

Incredible work. You've done a remarkable job in collecting these specimens. I can see that you spent a good deal of time collecting these at the Ma--in the wilderness! Great work! As promised, you are deserving of a fair reward.
KrankCollectionArmoredillo
KrankQuest
Come back tomorrow, I might have more work for you then.
KrankQuest
These are wonderful finds. I'm going to see that these find their way into our sages hands as quickly as possible. For now, I must get you your reward.
KrankCollectionGolem
KrankQuest
Come back tomorrow, I might have more work for you then.
KrankQuest

Nasty smell coming from this crate. You must have freshly killed the majority of these creatures. Your efforts should not go unrewarded and to prove that we Lugian's are as noble as we claim, I offer you these.
KrankCollectionSclavus
KrankQuest
Come back tomorrow, I might have more work for you then.
KrankQuest
I offer you my thanks and the small tokens that I shall give you in a moment. The information contained in this missive may one day save a great many lives.
KrankDeliveryMacNiall
KrankQuest
Come back tomorrow, I might have more work for you then.
KrankQuest
Gorak must have been pleased to see the axe, he overpaid. I'll make sure that this finds its way to him in a future payment. You've been a great help, please take this with my thanks.
KrankDeliveryDryreach
KrankQuest
Come back tomorrow, I might have more work for you then.
KrankQuest
Olcris is sure to have been up to something no good. I'll have a scholar look over this missive as soon as I take care of your reward.
KrankDeliveryStonehold
KrankQuest
Come back tomorrow, I might have more work for you then.
KrankQuest
Ugh! That was rather heavy, you could have warned me before just tossing into my arms like that. Cripes! Nonetheless, you did as I asked, so you are deserving of a fair reward. Here, take these.
KrankDeliveryWaiJhou
KrankQuest
Come back tomorrow, I might have more work for you then.
KrankQuest
SpokeToLugianSpy
Captain K'rank exclaims, %tn, "You have killed the Burun leader, Morgluuk!"
This head is proof of what you have done. All should know your name.

%tn has slain Morgluuk and returned his head to the Lugian capital of Linvak Tukal. There it is to be placed on a pike as a symbol of victory for the Isparian, Lugian and Tumerok people and a symbol of defeat for the Burun that threaten our way of life. Huzzah, %tn!
MorgluukKiller
EventHeadMorgluukLinvak
EventKivikLirMorgluukAlive
EventKivikLirMorgluukDead
You must be rewarded for your efforts.
The portal gem will take you into the High Queen's Vault. There you will find many chests that house treasures and weaponry that has been worked on by the finest smiths in the land.
Captain K'rank says, "Take your gift and use it well, %tn. You are deserved of much praise in this victory."
Captain K'rank says, "That is the final reward I have for you. You have become a hero to all of Dereth, %tn. I shall never forget your name or your deeds."
KrankMorgluuk
Captain K'rank says, "Hail %tn."
I see that you have returned to shatter the morale of the Burun again. Your efforts continue to assist our people in lessening the threat these creatures pose. Here are your rewards.
The key will open whichever chest you choose in that room. Each chest should clearly display what it holds.
That is all that I have to give.
Captain K'rank says, "Thank you again for your efforts, %tn."
Captain K'rank says, "Hail %tn."

Again you take the head of the Burun leader, Morgluuk. You are surely a hero to all. As we have already placed the creatures head outside of the city in your honor, this one will be turned into a trophy that you can display with honor.
%tn has defeated Morgluuk and received a glorious reward for their efforts.
You should also be able to draw your rewards from the High Queen's treasure as well. Here take this key and this gem.
As you know, this key opens whichever chest you choose within that room. You are due just another small token, %tn.
That is all I have to give.
Captain K'rank says, "You are a hero to us all, %tn."
You come have to aid us, no? Well then, let me see what I have for you.
KrankQuest

We're trying not to overwork you too much, so please finish up what we asked of you and then take some time for yourself. Come back to me tomorrow and I'll see what I can have you do."

You've familiar blood on your armor. It is the blood of our brothers who succumbed to the way of the Virindi. Is it possible that you have found Toberik? Quickly, if have news from him let me see it.
KrankMorgluuk
Filthy creatures these Burun. As promised you are to be rewarded for your efforts.
The key will open whichever chest you choose in that room. Each chest should clearly display what it holds.
That is all that I have to give.
Captain K'rank says, "Thank you again for your efforts, %tn."
A brave warrior who has continued our efforts to crush the morale of the Burun and the renegades. You have done well. Here take this and display it proudly.
%tn has defeated Morgluuk and received a glorious reward for their efforts.
The High Queen also wishes you to take a small reward from her coffers. Take these.
The key will open whichever chest you choose within the treasure room to which the gem brings you.
That is all that I have to give.
Captain K'rank says, "Thank you again for your efforts, %tn."

Hail Isparian, I am sorry if I appear preoccupied. I am waiting on a very important report from a spy working amongst the Renegades. His report from the Renegade fortress in the Direlands is overdue and we have seen an increase in the number of camps surrounding the fortress. I should not bother you with such concerns.
You have come to aid us, no? Well then, let me see what I have for you.
KrankQuest
Captain K'rank seems to consult some notes.
Let me see what I have for you.
KrankyQuests

Here is one. We are collecting information of the varying hides of the Armoredillos. We're looking into ways to create layered armor from their hides that would afford better than usual protection against all different forms of damage. Here take this.
KrankCollectionArmoredillo
KrankQuest

Put the specimens in this sack in the following order, no need to write this down, we've already listed the order on the outside of the sack. I'm just making sure that you've been told as well. Small armoredillo hide, followed by the regular hide, the large hide, then the sturdy hide and lastly the plate armoredillo hide. When you have filled the sack return it to me for a handsome reward of no less than five items. Hurry along now.

This one should prove interesting. Our sages are interested in the geomancy that makes the Golems 'live'. We need specimens of the Golem's hearts to continue our study. Since we're used to working with stones it comes as no surprise that we are specifically interested in the different stone and mineral golems. Take this.
KrankCollectionGolem
KrankQuest

Put the specimens in corresponding collection slots. They are listed on the front of the crate for easy reference. Just to be clear however, I will tell you the order they should be collected in. First collect a granite heart, followed by iron, copper, obsidian, gold and finally a diamond heart. Then return to me with the full crate.

A little less sanitary than other collections, but no less important. Recent findings by Isparian adventurers, the High Queen, Lugian Sages and Tumerok Mystics, has resulted in a wide-spread belief that the Sclavus are an amalgam of creatures. Yes, this was first proffered forth by other more notable scholars, but even the recent findings are still full of conjecture. Perhaps the Sclavus that live today are just an evolutionary product of that first race. Whatever the case we need samples to continue our studies.
KrankCollectionSclavus
KrankQuest

Inside the crate you'll find several bags labeled for the different body parts that are commonly harvested from the Sclavus. You should collect the specimens in the following order and then place them into the bags in the crate. The outside of the crate also has the order listed. But I want to make certain that I have done my best to inform you of your duty. Collect the small hide of the creature first, followed by the normal sized hide, the large hide and lastly add the tongue. When you have collected these four parts bring them back to me and I will give you a nice reward of no less than five items.

Not long ago I met a rugged traveler from the Island town of MacNiall's Freehold. This savvy traveler struck an efficacious deal with me, one that I intend to uphold as best I can. I'm to deliver a collection of treated herbs to him in exchange for some information that he has been collecting for me. If you're so disposed to assisting me, bring these herbs to MacNiall and return to me with the missive that he supplies you.
KrankDeliveryMacNiall
KrankQuest
Be swift, MacNiall's information is very important to our cause of unity. Hurry along now.

An old friend of mine, Gorak, was sent to support the besieged town at Dryreach. Unfortunately, Gorak was sent to the beleaguered city before he had time to pick up his new axe. If you'd be so kind to deliver the axe and collect payment from Gorak for the work, I am certain that I can muster a small reward for you.
KrankDeliveryDryreach
KrankQuest
Please, hurry. Every moment that Gorak is without his axe is another that the townsfolk of Dryreach live in danger of invasion.
Though many believe that we Lugian's have either thrown our lot in with High Queen Elysa or with that traitorous dog, Muldaveus.
Captain K'rank spits.

Excuse me... That belief is untrue. Some Lugians actually struck out on their own when Nuhmudira was claiming that she desired to create a grand place of learning. One such Lugian, Olcris, joined with Nuhmudira and started acting very strangely. Well... my reach isn't so short that I don't have eyes on him. In fact, I have a contact at the Beach Fort that keeps up with all his comings and goings at Stonehold. His price is steep, but we honor his price. His name is Feruza ibn Salaq and his price is here.
KrankDeliveryStonehold
KrankQuest
It's a small price to pay someone for such important information. Feruza's reports and return them to me for a fair reward.

I am certain that you're aware that we assisted in the reclamation and restoration process of Wai Jhou, yes? I was never given to trying to make a swamp city better. Honestly, it's in a swamp. They'll be lucky if that town doesn't fall down, sink into the swamp, then burn and sink into the swamp before a real city thrives there. I'm sorry, got a little off topic. We have a worker stationed there, Kreavon.
Kreavon is responsible for collecting minerals, they can get quite heavy over time. We've crafted this wheelcart for his use. Would you mind brining it to him?
KrankDeliveryWaiJhou
KrankQuest
Wait for Kreavon to fill the cart, then return it to me for a fair reward.
MorgluukKiller@01
